title: Why ‘Loss and Damage’ Is a Climate Talks Battleground
dc:creator: By Eric Roston | Bloomberg
description: Pollution from developed countries set climate change in motion. But it’s the countries left behind by industrialization that are feeling the heat. Now, those poorer nations are demanding what’s known in the climate debate as “loss and damage” -- financial and technological help to cope with problems they didn’t cause. It’s an issue that could dominate the global climate talks set for November in Egypt.
